Settlement.name: {=!}Chaos Portal
Settlement.text: {=!}Chaos Portal

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AV1}Averheim
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Averheim is the capital city of the Grand Province of Averland, and the original capital of the ancient Brigundians tribe.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AV1_1}Streissen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AV1_1}Streissen is a town in Averland that harbors a ferry system, and a history of volatile conspiracy.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AV1_4}Heideck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AV1_4}Heideck is an Imperial town located at the crossroads of the Old Dwarf Road just before reaching the capital of Averheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AV2_1}Calmfahre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AV2_1}Tirby sits in the cold misty waters that lie off of the Ebor peninsula. The low-lying lands on the northern side of the Ebor are suited to the growing of flax.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AV2_2}Loningbruck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AV2_2}Loningbruck is a small town in south-central Averland. Located at a major crossroads just north of the Upper Reik.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AV3}Grenzstadt
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Grenzstadt is an Imperial fortress-town that is located at the northwestern end of Black Fire Pass.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST1}Wurtbad
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Wurtbad rests on the banks of the river Stir and it´s the capital of the province. By far the most densely populated town in Stirland, it is also home to the crumbling Temple of Myrmida. The nobility and people of Wurtbad are famous for its suspiciousness and sombreness, as the lost province of Sylvania is too close for comfort. It is one of the few places where goods can be carried over the river, making it an excellent strategic checkpoint for anyone wishing to push onwards into the land.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ST1_1}Biberhof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ST1_1}Biberhof lies surrounded by thick forest just a few kilometers south of Wurtbad. Its inhabitants have become quite skilled in the use of the axe, both to harvest high quality wood from the old trees around it and defending their camps from vermin and the occasional highwayman. The timber from Biderhof is sought after by the nobility of Wurtbad, as it is said its dark hues is anathema to any vampire unlucky enough to be skewed by a stake made from this wood.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ST1_2}Julbach
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ST1_2}Julbach is located halfway between River Stir and River Aver. It sits in a valley shadowed by the Zaya hills where sheep roam freely along Nuln road. The Nattern Forest, a few miles to the West, serves as both a source of wealth and superstition, as even in the coldest nights of winter, when both insect and beast sleep, a rumble of hooves can be heard in the distance.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ST1_3}Oberwil
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ST1_3}Oberwil is a small fishing village a few miles West of Wurtbad. The routes to Oberwil are little more than footpaths, as most trade and travel is done via river. The village is somewhat protected by the Riverwardens who frequent the Stir, but villagers generally have to fend for themselves against bandits and beastmen from the dark forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ST1_4}Tarshof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ST1_4}Tarshof is situated on the Northern edge of the Stirhügel hills. The village enjoys plenty of traffic from traders travelling between Wurtbad and Wörden along the Old Dwarf Road. As a result almost every house in the village professes to be an Inn, although the hospitality varies wildly and travellers are as likely to find themselves sleeping on a pile of hay as a proper pallet bed.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_ST1}Flensburg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_ST1}Flensburg is a small market town nestled in the Zaya Hills to the West of the Stirhügel. The hills are perfect for sheep grazing, and the town’s economy is based on fleece, lamb and mutton trade. The town is also noted in the region for having a major temple of Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ST1_1}Lochen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ST1_1}Lochen is a subsidiary settlement of the nearby town Flensburg. The village mostly consists of farmers who supply the market town with grain. Lochen falls under the protection of Countess Petra Harden and her troops.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_ST2}Franzen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_ST2}Franzen is a somewhat unremarkable town, sitting in the shadow of large settlements nearby. It has a healthy fishing trade from the Lammer and the Aver, and also boasts a well-used ferry across the Lammer, which allows travellers to continue the road West to Russbach.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ST2_1}Chrobok
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ST2_1}Chrobok is a small farming community situated in the low wetlands between the rivers Mattid, Lammer and Aver. The natural irrigation provided by the rivers has made the region perfect arable land, and the nearby Franzen and Averheim enjoy a bountiful supply of grain from the village.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ST2_2}Russbach
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ST2_2}Russbach is a hamlet situated in the sodden fens to the South of the Stirhügel hills. Just beneath the surface of the earth are deep clay pits, and the people of Russbach make a living by mining the building material. Travellers know they’re near the village when they can smell the acrid smoke of the brickmakers’ kilns.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST2}Leicheberg
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}At the edge of the Haunted Hills by the source of the Black Run River, Leicheberg lives in fear of its neighbour to the east.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST3}Siegfriedhof
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Siegfriedhof lies on the borderlands with the County of Sylvania near Hunger Wood.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST4}Mittlenburg
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Sir seaghouls place to hang out it's fresh mountainair for his boypussy

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_ST4}Wördern
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ST4_1}Wördern is a small town hidden between mountains and valleys. The rough terrain makes expansion near impossible, but the intersection of the Old Dwarf Road and the Prager strasse makes passing along viable; not that it matters, as no outsider finds kindness in Wörden. The odd mootlander can occasionally be seen purchasing supplies for the road, but its main attraction is the Wörden Meat and Cattle auction house. It’s the only town in Stirland that can be smelled before it is seen.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ST4_1}Nussbach
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ST4_1}Nussbach is a small hamlet at the fork of River Lammer, where its two sources meet. The fertile flats at its south are the perfect spot to raise cattle, which Nussbachers have been doing for generations. The peaceful village is only bothered from time to time with land disputes from upstart Averland nobles.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ST4_2}Kelham
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ST4_2}Kelham is isolated among the hills of the Old Dwarf Road. Its secluded location allows the inhabitants to peacefully farm wheat and other cereals. Its golden fields go just about the start of Altern Forest, where the fertility of the land drops inexplicably. Whatever is not used for local consumption is sent out along the Moot Road to the rest of eastern Stirland and, ultimately, the Mootlands.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MT1}Eicheschatten
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Eicheschatten, the capital of the Mootland is utterly unprepossessing at first glance. After a longer examination, one’s opinion is confirmed.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MT1_1}Gipfel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MT1_1}Gipfel, A small village in the heart of the Greenleaf Hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MT1}Castle Drakenhof
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Castle Drakenhof was the former capital of the Imperial province of Sylvania during the reign of its last Imperial noble, Count Otto von Drak.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_SY1_1}Templehof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_SY1_1}This town in Sylvania, bordering the imperial province of Stirland is named for its famed temple of Morr.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_SY2}Waldenhof
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}The capital of Sylvania, Waldenhof, is a walled town that sits where the rivers come together to create the Stir.
